Based on the preferences and cues you've provided, I'd recommend "The Pianist" as a potentially good choice.

"The Pianist" is a critically acclaimed drama film released in 2002. The movie is based on a novel of the same name by Władysław Szpilman. 

The movie tells the story of Władysław Szpilman, a renowned Polish pianist who was stranded in Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp during World War II.

After spending 10 years in silence and isolation, Szpilman returned to his piano in order to regain his musical skills.

The movie "The Pianist" tells the story of Władysław Szpilman, a renowned Polish pianist who was stranded in Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp during World War II.
